data.title: The Stoller Hall
data.meta_description: An incredible opportunity to hear Professor Balázs Szokolay at The Stoller Hall for the first time. A prizewinner at many international piano and chamber
data.text:
CHOPIN

Nocturne in C# minor, Op.Posth.

Polonaise in C# minor, Op. 26 No. 1

Polonaise in A major, Op. 40 No. 1

Nocturne in C# minor, Op.27 No. 1

Mazurka in F# minor, Op.6 No. 1

Mazurka in B minor Op.30 No. 2

Mazurka in A minor Op.17 No. 4

Mazurka in D-major Op.33 No. 2

Nocturne in C minor Op.48 No. 1

Nocturne in Eb major Op.9 No. 2

Polonaise in C minor Op.40 No. 2

Mazurka in C major Op.24 No. 2

Mazurka in F minor Op.68

An incredible opportunity to hear Professor Balázs Szokolay at The Stoller Hall for the first time. A prizewinner at many international piano and chamber music competitions, he is now also a hugely respected teacher. Currently Professor of Piano at the Franz Liszt Academy of Music in Weimar, his students have won more than 50 international prizes in different music competitions.
